channel.title: Ss
channel.description:
Warcraft II tides of darkness russian server I play on has this screen shot feature which basically determines if people are cheating. You pause the game and declare someone to upload a SS if you believe they are autocasting.
You can look at how it is setup here. http://ss.war2.ru/view.php
Having moderators going around asking for SS is just dumb but what if from a communities standpoint players in the wild can declare someone to provide a screenshot and moderators can take action if they don't.
What do you think?

item.title: Ss
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Why not just do something like this?

public void createPacket(int packetID) { if(packetID != 255) { createPacket(255); add4ByteInt(mudclient.mouseX); add4ByteInt(mudclient.mouseY); formatPacket(); } ... }

Read full topic

item.title: Ss
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:2, topic:534675”]description: little dick with hax 3

why not just have some code in the client that would return the buffered image to the client. 9 times out of 10 a bot will have some shitty draw function[/quote]that’s pretty easy to notice and bypass

Read full topic
